metadata.title: CVE-2016-4554 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
mime_header.cc in Squid before 3.5.18 allows remote attackers to bypassintended same-origin restrictions and possibly conduct cache-poisoningattacks via a crafted HTTP Host header, aka a "header smuggling" issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4554` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid-cgi - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid-purge - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid3 - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid3-common - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squidclient - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8').
